Contradict fact: None of the expert statements contradict any factual information provided in the claim.
Exaggerate: None of the expert statements contain any exaggerated claims.
Understate: None of the expert statements appear to understate any information.
Falters at times: None of the expert statements show any signs of faltering.
Lack enough support: None of the expert statements lack sufficient support as they are backed by medical professionals and organizations.
Problematic assumption: The claim itself makes a problematic assumption that the COVID-19 vaccine causes female sterilization, which is not supported by any credible evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The experts provide alternative explanations by stating that there is no biological possibility for the vaccine to negatively impact fertility and that the risk of getting COVID-19 during pregnancy poses a greater risk to maternal and fetal health.
